messages.message: it’s downloading the image. give it some time to run?
Ah, I thought it had stalled
gigantic image, will take a while
yup -- you should always see that in travis :slightly_smiling_face:
@Heymian the slowness seems to be crashing it?
@Chetan Did we hit an endless loop or something while figuring out which tests to run/build?

the actual dependency tracing seems to have finished fine (`echo "Testing distributed-tasks/celery/image-tasks shared-utils/py-utils/acl-access shared-utils/py-utils/app-utils shared-utils/py-utils/data-export-utils shared-utils/py-utils/flow/server shared-utils/py-utils/recipe-utils shared-utils/py-utils/refinerv5-utils shared-utils/py-utils/visual-refiner/client shared-utils/py-utils/visual-refiner/server webserver/api-server webserver/api-server-apps webserver/apps-server webserver/shared webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked webserver/webapp"`)

It seems the `go run runtest.go` command is what ran into problems…. i’ve never seen this before though where it simply outputs nothing.
i hit retry :man-shrugging: let’s see if it replicates. if yes, i’ll try to reproduce it locally.
will have to do that tonight though — about to leave for the airport for the metlife on-site.

happening consistently — I see it also happened on one of Erick’s PR’s. specifically, travis gets hung on `image-tasks`. Erick’s PR had the package before (docops-lib) run correctly, and in Ted’s case _none_ ran because image-tasks was the first one.
i can reproduce on master inside the jenkins container — image-tasks just hangs on PY3 after unit tests.

we’re not hitting this problem on master because of a bug with the way `test-all` works — it’s missing all the leaf services (image-tasks, app-tasks, etc.). this problem is only hit on these specific branches because they change image-tasks code triggering the PR to take a look at image-tasks.
this PY3 unit test hanging problem for image-tasks must have creeped in some time between david/i introducing `test-changes` and now.
maybe a jenkinsfile change caused it… first i’ll fix the `test-all` bug. PR: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/11361 @Heymian @dlluncor
i’m at metlife all day tomorrow though — @Heymian any chance you could help look into this PY3 image-tasks unit tests hanging post-success problem?
yup, i can look, but if it has something to do with a specific bad test, i’m not going to have a whole lot of context with what those tests do
yea if you can find the test, that makes the task easier for someone else. i’m not sure it is though (from the screenshot I posted earlier — it could be misleading though).
